UTSA-74 has two different Zn2+ sites, one of which (Zn1) is tetrahedral, while the other (Zn2) has an octahedral coordination geometry. Upon activation, the two axial water molecules on the Zn2 site can be removed, yielding UTSA-74a with two accessible gas binding sites per Zn2 ion.

The accessible Zn2+ sites in UTSA-74a are bridged by carbon dioxide molecules rather than ultimately bound in Zn-MOF-74, so UTSA-74a adsorbs much less carbon dioxide (90 cm3/cm3) than Zn-MOF at room temperature and 1 bar, making it a high-quality MOF material for highly selective C2H2/CO2 separation.
